Most of the R packages of the **tesselle** project are distributed on [<abbr title="Comprehensive R Archive Network">CRAN</abbr>](https://cran.r-project.org/) when they reach an acceptable level of maturity. Development versions can be installed from [GitHub](https://github.com/tesselle) using [remotes](https://remotes.r-lib.org) :


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Install the development version from GitHub
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("tesselle/tabula")
```
:::


Thanks to the [R-universe](https://ropensci.org/r-universe/) project powered by [rOpenSci](https://ropensci.org), **tesselle** now has its own <abbr title="Comprehensive R Archive Network">CRAN</abbr>-like repository: [**tesselle.r-universe.dev**](https://tesselle.r-universe.dev). This repository allows to install all development versions and non-<abbr title="Comprehensive R Archive Network">CRAN</abbr> packages (e.g. [<abbr title="work-in-progress">WIP</abbr>](https://www.repostatus.org/#wip) packages and large data packages).

## Download tesselle packages

If you want to install a package from the [tesselle universe](https://tesselle.r-universe.dev), simply use `install.packages()` with the additional repository:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Install a package from the 'tesselle' universe
install.packages("tabula", repos = "https://tesselle.r-universe.dev")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## Enable the repository globally
options(repos = c(tesselle = "https://tesselle.r-universe.dev",
                  CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org"))

## Install some packages
install.packages(c("tabula", "kairos"))
```
:::


## Use the repository

You can use this repository in your R package (if available, <abbr title="Comprehensive R Archive Network">CRAN</abbr> releases must be regarded as the preferred source). To do so, prepare the `DESCRIPTION` file of your R package:

* List the package under `Suggests:`
* Add the line `Additional_repositories: https://tesselle.r-universe.dev`
* Test your package with `R CMD check --as-cran`
